speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Care for some brie?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thank you Daphne.  Isn't Niles taking you to dinner soon?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, but if I don't have a little snack now, I'll just make a pig of meself later.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm really starting to worry about her.  _The doorbell rings and Frasier gets up to answer it.  Martin gets up from his chair._

speaker: Martin
text: You're worried?  Somewhere on a poultry farm a bunch of chickens are holdin' a prayer vigil.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah!  Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_entering_] Hello, Frasier.  Look at what I brought: chocolate covered honey nougat praline bombs!  And they're jumbos!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we knew they weren't for us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Niles.  This may be a bit of a sensitive subject, but have you noticed anything... different about Daphne lately?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she's happier, as am I.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess I meant more in a... physical way.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she trimmed her bangs, that was a week ago.  Men!

speaker: Frasier
text: I, I guess what I'm really talking about is her... size.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's my fault.  I was self-conscious about our height difference and I asked her to stop wearing high-heeled shoes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_giving in_] I hope one day to love a woman the way you love Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't worry, you will, you will. [_They hug._] Now, where's my little sparrow?

speaker: Frasier
text: She's in the kitchen.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny.  Gosh, this is a surprise.

speaker: Kenny
text: I'm sorry to drop by like this, it's just that I'm in a terrible bind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there something wrong at the station?

speaker: Kenny
text: [_entering_] No, no, it's personal.  I stopped by a bar last night to watch the game, and I started talking to this woman, Janice.  She was so beautiful, and she had this great laugh, and she smelled... good.  And for some crazy reason, she liked me too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Kenny, what did you do?

speaker: Kenny
text: I made a date with her.  She's waiting for me right now at Chez Henri!  I've never done anything like this before.  I'm a married man with kids and I have a date!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny!  Listen, if you go down and meet with this woman, it could be the end of your marriage.  Now, I've never met your wife, but you've always spoken very highly of her.  Are you prepared to lose her?

speaker: Kenny
text: No!

speaker: Frasier
text: Then you can't go.

speaker: Kenny
text: Stand Janice up?  She'll wonder what happened, she'll call my house.

speaker: Frasier
text: You gave this woman your home number?

speaker: Kenny
text: I'm new at this!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God.  All right, well, you're just gonna have to go down there and tell her the whole thing's off.

speaker: Kenny
text: No, no.  Don't make me go down there, Doc.  I'm weak.  One look in her eyes and those sexy, full lips... well, maybe a quick hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, Kenny, wait!  Maybe you're right, maybe you shouldn't go down there.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, what else am I gonna do?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, uh... Go home.  I'll go down and talk to her for you.

speaker: Kenny
text: Wow.  You'd really do that?  Thanks Doc!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes.  All right.  Okay. [_He separates them and gets his coat._] What name did you make the reservation under?

speaker: Kenny
text: Kenny Daly.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you thinking?

speaker: Kenny
text: They know me there, I wanted a good table!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.   _A woman (Janice) waits at a table.  Another woman (Kenny's wife (!)) walks up._

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Excuse me.  Are you Janice?

speaker: Janice
text: Yes.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: The Janice who's meeting Kenny Daly?

speaker: Janice
text: Yes, is there a problem?

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Just one: I'm his wife!

speaker: Janice
text: Oh, my God!  He didn't tell me he was married!

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Why am I not surprised?

speaker: Janice
text: [_getting up_] Well, I am so sorry. [_She thinks a moment._] Oh, now you must have heard my message on your answering machine.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Yeah.  And for your information, Kenny's eyes are brown, not "hazelicious"!

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: [_to waiter_] Uh, excuse me.  Could you please take... this? [_She hands Janice's wine to him._]

speaker: Waiter
text: Yes, ma'am.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, are you meeting Kenny Daly?

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: You bet I am!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm Frasier Crane.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Yes, I know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.  It's always nice to meet a fan. [_He sits._] Anyway, I'm afraid I have a bit of bad news.  You see, Kenny won't be making it tonight.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Why not?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, uh, there's something you should know about Kenny. Janice, isn't it?

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Uh... yes.  Janice.

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, Kenny's married.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  He wanted to come down and tell you himself, but I insisted that I come instead.  You see, he finds you so attractive, that he can't control himself around you.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Is that right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  In fact, I practically had to wrestle him away from the door.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: I don't believe this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Janice...  Listen, there's no need to cry.  You know, there are other fish in the sea.  And certainly a woman as beautiful as you could have her pick.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: You don't have to say that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it's true.

speaker: Waiter
text: Are you ready to order?

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Oh, we're not staying.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just hang on a second.  Janice, listen, I'm free tonight, what do you say I buy you dinner?

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Oh, I don't know...

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, you deserve to have a nice evening.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Well, I haven't been out in a long time.

speaker: Frasier
text: There, see?  There you go.  You know, they happen to make a sumptuous creme brulee here.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Really?  Well... why the hell not?   **MOONSTUCK**  _Fade in.  Niles and Daphne are coming in the front.  Niles is carrying a foil swan used for take-home by fancy restaurants._

speaker: Niles
text: Here we go.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  I'll just put this in the fridge.

speaker: Daphne
text: That sure was a snooty restaurant.  The waitress' eyebrows nearly hit the ceiling when I asked for a doggy bag.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know what their problem was, the people at the next table barely touched this pork chop.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne? _Reset to: the living room as Niles hurries out.  Daphne is on the floor in front of Martin's chair.  Niles comes over to her._

speaker: Niles
text: What happened?

speaker: Daphne
text: I stepped on Eddie's chew toy and twisted my ankle.  I don't think I can get up.

speaker: Niles
text: Here, here, let me help you.  _He reaches down and takes her hands.  He tries to pull her up, but simply grimaces with the strain._

speaker: Niles
text: Damn these weak shanks!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, it's not you, it's me!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't be silly.  You're light as a feather.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Niles, look at me!  I'm a tub!

speaker: Niles
text: Darling, no.  You might be perhaps a bit sturdier, but I love you no matter what your size.  I need to create some sort of fulcrum. _He sits on the coffee table, his legs under and tries to push her up, without success._

speaker: Daphne
text: I've spent weeks watching meself expand.  I kept hoping it would go away by itself.

speaker: Niles
text: Well I'm sure all those sweets and lavish dinners I've heaped on you haven't helped.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's not your fault.  I just need to develop some willpower.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll help you.  We'll commit to a program of healthy eating and exercise.  Together, there's nothing we can't... _He tries to push a bit lower but his strength gives out and she slowly falls back on top of him._

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe if I throw a rope over that beam.

speaker: Martin
text: What happened?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne tripped over something and fell.

speaker: Martin
text: Where's Eddie?!  Oh my God!  Eddie!  Eddie!

speaker: Martin
text: [_covering_] Oh, there he is.  I thought he might've ran away or somethin'.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, darling, look at that.  Your ankle's swelling up already. [_He points._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's the other one!

speaker: Martin
text: Here, let me give you a hand.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, and no cracks, old man!  I know I've gotten heavy and I've resolved to do something about it.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, on three.  One, two, three!

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe the super has a hand truck.

speaker: Daphne
text: Kill me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, what happened?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne twisted her ankle and fell.  Come help us lift her.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, boys, be careful.  Use your legs. _Working together, they lift Daphne up.  She leans forward to get her balance._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, bloody hell!  I'm wearing two different shoes! _The doorbell rings.  Frasier goes to answer it as Niles helps Daphne off to her room._

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne, I just thought of somethin' funny: It took three Cranes to lift you! _Daphne glares at him and he suddenly finds it less funny. Frasier answers the door.  It is Kenny._

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny.  I thought you left hours ago.

speaker: Kenny
text: I tried to, but I kept circling the block.  I couldn't go home until I knew everything was taken care of.

speaker: Frasier
text: Rest assured, you're off the hook.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, thanks Doc.  How did Janice take it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I must say, she was rather attached to you, but I convinced her it was time to move on.

speaker: Kenny
text: You're sure she's over me?  'Cause once I get under a lady's skin, I'm like a splinter.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm positive.  Listen, Kenny, about Janice.  There's something I'd like to ask you: See, we sort of hit it off. I made plans to see her again.  Is that okay with you?

speaker: Kenny
text: Are you kidding?  Anything for the guy who saved my marriage. I only hope this woman makes you as happy as my wife makes me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks.  Okay.  Let's save a little for the ladies, shall we?   _End of Act 1  Act 2_ **HUNGRY HEART**  _Fade in.  Daphne comes in from her room as Frasier enters from the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, listen.  My date'll be here any second and I can't seem to find the water crackers.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh.  Blame your brother.  He cleared the kitchen of anything with any sugar, fat or flavor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, well.  You know, I must say Daphne, I've admired your resolve the past few days.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you, Dr. Crane. _He exits.  Daphne watches as he leaves, then goes to the bookshelf and pulls a box of chocolates from between two books.  She opens it and quickly eats a couple.  The doorbell rings._

speaker: Daphne
text: Bloody hell.  _She closes the box and puts it back.  Frantically chewing to finish the chocolates in her mouth, she goes to the door and opens it to reveal Niles._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hi Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, what's that?

speaker: Niles
text: Here it is: the Body Sculptor 100!  Guaranteed to work twelve muscle groups all at once.

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought you were getting the 300.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, couldn't lift it.  Set it up in your room?

speaker: Daphne
text: Great, right behind you!  _As Niles exits to Daphne's room, she pulls the box of chocolates out again.  Before she can have any, the doorbell rings again and she puts it back.  Frasier comes from his room and Daphne hurries off to hers. Frasier answers the door.  It is Kenny._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Kenny!

speaker: Kenny
text: [_entering_] Sorry to barge in on you, I didn't know where else to turn.  I think my wife's having an affair.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, now, Kenny, try to calm down.  Isn't it entirely possible that because you were thinking of cheating yourself, you're just projecting your guilt onto her?

speaker: Kenny
text: No, no, Doc.  She's been acting all weird lately.  And tonight she went to a PTA meeting with her Wonder Bra jacked up to her chin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord, that'll be Janice.  We have a date.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, no, I don't want to see her!  That might be a little awkward.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right.  Okay, tell you what: why don't you wait in my bedroom, it's right down the hall there.  And I'll send her to the kitchen and come get you when the coast is clear.  _Kenny goes off to the bedrooms while Frasier opens the door to Mrs. Daly._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Janice, come on in. [_She enters._] Here let me take your coat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, gosh, you look lovely.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Thank you. [_She looks around._] What a nice place.  I'm not used to a man with such good taste.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sure that's not true.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Oh, it is, it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Janice, if you'll forgive me, I have something I need to take care of in the other room.  I'll tell you what, why don't you head into the kitchen and select a wine.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Oh, I wouldn't know what to pick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right.  On the counter you'll find my wine log. Just select something from "Frasier's Favorites."  _She heads into the kitchen as Frasier goes to the bedrooms. CUT TO: Frasier's room. Kenny is pacing nervously as Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Kenny, Janice is in the kitchen so you're free to go.

speaker: Kenny
text: Go where?  To an empty house?  An all-night movie?  Just walk the streets?

speaker: Frasier
text: All those sound good.

speaker: Kenny
text: I can't take it anymore!  I'm gonna call her cell phone. I'll tell her I love her and demand she come home!  Instead of crying on your shoulder, it's time I started acting like a man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good for you!

speaker: Kenny
text: Can you dial for me?  My hands are sweaty. _Frasier takes the phone.  CUT TO: the living room. Daphne comes from her room, a towel around her neck and panting. Looking around to make sure no one is there, she goes to the box on top of the television.  Opening it, she takes out an eclair and takes a big bite._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne! _She looks around, desperately, then puts the eclair into the Chihuly sculpture by the hallway, pretending to dust it with her towel as Niles comes in from her room._

speaker: Niles
text: Good news.  I fixed the exercise machine.  Turns out you didn't bend the frame, you just popped one of the springs. What are you doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane insisted I dust all knick-knacks before going out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Good God, man!  Just because Daphne lives here doesn't mean she's at your beck and call twenty four hours a day!  As soon as we finish our obliques, we're out of here whether you like it or not!

speaker: Daphne
text: Tyrant!  _She leaves to her room, leaving a confused Frasier to head for the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: Janice?

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Kenny, I'll have to call you back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi.  Have you selected a wine?

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Uh, Frasier, I'm beginning to have second thoughts about this date.  It's about Kenny.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord, you're still thinking about Kenny.  Listen, I know Kenny, I like Kenny, but he's married.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Well, I know...

speaker: Frasier
text: And yet, he left his loving wife and family at home so he could go trolling bars for women.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Maybe he regrets that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yeah, sure.  Men ALWAYS change.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Are you saying I can't trust him?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I'm saying that you deserve a man who thinks you're as special as I do.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: You are very persuasive.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now if you'll excuse me, I'll be back in one moment.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: All right.  _Frasier exits.  Reset to: the living room as he comes in.  Martin is putting on his coat._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  I thought you were going to clear out tonight.  I've got a date.

speaker: Kenny
text: Doc, I need you in the bedroom.

speaker: Martin
text: Pretty.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm just taking Eddie for a walk and then I'll beat it on over to McGinty's, all right?  _As he heads for the bedroom, he notices something.  He reaches into the sculpture and pulls out the eclair._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  For God's sake, how many times do I have to tell you, my Chihuly is not a trash can! _He thrusts the eclair into Martin's hand and stomps off.  Martin looks confused a moment, then shrugs and takes a bite as he heads for the door.  CUT TO: Frasier's bedroom.   Kenny is sitting on the bed, staring at his wallet photos._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Kenny, time to go.

speaker: Kenny
text: Look at her.  How did I ever let a woman like this get away?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll tell you what, let me work up some preliminary thoughts over the weekend.

speaker: Kenny
text: Look at this one.  It's her at the Grand Canyon.  I ask you: which one is the true natural wonder?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God!

speaker: Kenny
text: Yeah, those were the breast-feeding months.  Good times.  _CUT TO: the living room. Daphne hurries across the room and looks in the Chihuly for her eclair, confused at it's absence.  The doorbell rings.  She opens it to reveal Roz._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hi Roz, come on in.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't stay, I just brought you that low-fat cookbook I was telling you about.

speaker: Daphne
text: You look nice.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thanks.  I'm going to a club tonight.  I got this new perfume that's just loaded with pheromones.

speaker: Daphne
text: What are those?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know, some sort of hormone that's supposed to get a guy all excited.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughing_] You really think it'll work?

speaker: Roz
text: It's worth a try.  After all it is approved by the "Food and Love Administration."  Check it out.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't smell anything.

speaker: Roz
text: Really?  Maybe I should put some more on.  Do you mind?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, go ahead.  _Roz goes into the powder room.  CUT TO: Frasier's room.  Kenny and Frasier are sitting on the bed._

speaker: Kenny
text: What kind of person goes out with another man's wife and tears a family apart?!  I mean there are children involved here!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right now, listen, let's not get overly dramatic, all right?

speaker: Kenny
text: God, if you're listening, let me have vengeance on his soul! [_getting up_] I gotta go.

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  No, no, no. You're only going to do something rash. I'll tell you what, Kenny, I want you to lie down on the bed.

speaker: Kenny
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  This is a very effective anger management technique.

speaker: Kenny
text: All right. [_He lays down._]

speaker: Frasier
text: There you go.  Just lean back, close your eyes and count to a hundred... thousand.  _He hurries out.  CUT TO: the living room. Janice is on the couch when Frasier comes in._

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Oh, Frasier, I'm ready for that wine, now. [_She holds up the glasses._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You're Kenny's wife!

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: Oh, God! [_She puts the wine down._] How did you find out?

speaker: Frasier
text: He's in my bedroom.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: He came here asking for advice.  He thought you were cheating on him, which you very nearly were.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: I've gotta get out of here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Why did you lie to me?

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: I was angry and hurt and mixed up and you were so nice to me and I don't know...

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, you have to understand something, Kenny loves you. Yes, he was attracted to someone, but please, you have to forgive him for that.  I mean, after all, you were attracted to me.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: That was more revenge.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  Well, that's neither here nor there. [_He opens the door for her._] Listen, it was nice to meet you.

speaker: Mrs. Daly
text: It was nice to meet you.  I just want to thank you.  For making an ordinary housewife feel so...

speaker: Kenny
text: [_from the hallway_] Hey, Doc?

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodbye.

speaker: Kenny
text: That anger management's a load of crap!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, Kenny.  Your wife is not cheating on you.  Don't ask me how I know that.  Maybe it's because of the hundreds of people I've counseled over the years, maybe, maybe it's just a hunch, I don't know.  It's just that yes, the two of you have problems, but they're the kinds of problems people have when they've been in a relationship a long time.  All you need to do is talk.  I want you to go home.  I'm sure you'll find your wife there waiting for you.

speaker: Kenny
text: I hope you're right.  Thanks Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, any time.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_noticing_] That's my wife's purse.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?  That's not your wife's purse.

speaker: Kenny
text: Yes it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's not.

speaker: Kenny
text: I know my wife's purse, I got it for her birthday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lots of women can have the same purse.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, if it's not hers, why don't you let me see it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, I've gotta tell you something.  It's a little complicated and I'm sure that in the future we'll all have a good laugh over it.  It's just that well, I did not have a date with Janice tonight.

speaker: Kenny
text: Well, you had a date with someone.  The wine, the fire...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I did have a date.  But it was with...

speaker: Kenny
text: Roz?

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly.

speaker: Roz
text: What are you guys talkin' about?

speaker: Roz
text: Wow!  That stuff really works.  Maybe I should wipe some of it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Here, take your purse.

speaker: Roz
text: Wait, Frasier, what are you talking about?  This isn't my...  _Frasier grabs her again and bends her over for another kiss.  Martin comes in and walks past them._

speaker: Martin
text: I don't want to know. _He exits to the kitchen.  Frasier breaks the kiss and shoves Roz into the powder room._

speaker: Kenny
text: You dog!  Oh, by the way, Doc, I owe you some chocolates. I got a little hungry in your room and I noticed that box of Fanny Farmers you got stuck between two books?  Thanks again.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_confused_] I don't keep chocolate in my room... [_He knocks on the powder room door._] Roz!  Get out here.

speaker: Roz
text: Try to control yourself!  _She pulls the door shut, Niles and Daphne look at each other in confusion._

speaker: Martin
text: Who stashed a box of doughnuts behind Eddie's dog food?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_quickly_] Well, we better get going.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay. _He helps her on with her coat, but her hand pushes something out of the sleeve onto the floor.  Niles picks it up to find it is a Toblerone bar._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne?  Is there something you want to tell me?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sheepishly_] I love you?

speaker: Niles
text: Anything else?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_breaking down_] I love chocolate.  And pastries and, oh God, I can't stop eating.  I'm out of control.

speaker: Niles
text: Come here, come here, it's all right my love.  We're going to get you through this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course we will, Daph.  You know, there are professionals who can help.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, they can wire your jaw shut, staple your stomach, put a balloon in your gut...

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you Dad!  I was referring to something more like a spa, all right?  Although you might look into that jaw thing!

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I, I think a spa is a wonderful idea.  They can oversee your diet and plan your exercise and help you understand why you're overeating.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Most importantly, Daphne, you should know that we love you, and you're not alone.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: No!  You stay right there!  I don't blame you, I blame the people at Mantastic.
